rainyday.title: A Message for a Rainy Day
rainyday.subtitle: Date Plan
rainyday.heroSubtitle: A heartfelt ritual: Write letters to each other now, seal them with care, and open them only when a specific moment arrives—turning your words into time capsules of love.
rainyday.sectionTitle: The Process: "Warmth at the Tip of Your Pen"

dresscode.title: Dress Code & Vibe
dresscode.subtitle: Creating the Right Atmosphere
dresscode.description: The key is comfort and coziness. Think soft fabrics, warm layers, and your favorite loungewear that makes you feel relaxed and creative.

topics: Share a favorite memory from your relationship
Describe what you admire most about your partner
Write about your hopes and dreams for the future
Express gratitude for specific moments or qualities
Share a vulnerable thought or feeling
Describe how your partner makes you feel loved

steps.title: The Letter Workshop
steps.subtitle: Words for the Future
steps.content: Settle into your cozy corners and write your partner a letter that is sincere, warm, and completely unguarded. The main goal is to be a source of support and to bring a genuine smile to their face when the letter is finally opened down the road.
ideas: Tuck in something symbolic: A ticket stub from your first movie date, a pressed flower, or a tiny doodle
Spritz the paper with your signature scent to add an extra dimension of memory

steps.title: The Sealing Ritual
steps.subtitle: Creating the Secret
steps.content: Once finished, the letters are folded and sealed in their envelopes. The contents must remain a complete secret until Day "X." That element of intrigue is what creates the real magic.
ideas: Use a wax seal with your initials or a heart symbol
Invent and draw your own coat of arms or a secret couple's sign on the envelope

steps.title: Rules of the Game
steps.subtitle: When to Open the Envelope
steps.content: Discuss and agree on the one condition that will allow each of you to break the seal. This rule must be the same for both of you. It could be an emotional state or a specific situation.
ideas: "Open when you feel like you're alone"
"Open on the day the rain outside is the grimmest and gloomiest"

steps.title: The Final Act
steps.subtitle: The Time Capsule
steps.content: Pick a special place for your letters—a beautiful decorative box, an old wine crate, or a secret shelf in the bookcase—where they will wait for their moment.
ideas: Take a photo as you place the letters into their "vault." That picture will be the very first exhibit in your future "Gallery of Warm Memories"

starrynight.title: Starry Night Contemplation
starrynight.subtitle: Date Plan
starrynight.heroSubtitle: Escape the city lights and find a quiet spot to gaze at the stars together. Bring blankets, hot drinks, and simply exist under the infinite sky.

dresscode.title: Dress Code & Vibe
dresscode.subtitle: Stay Warm, Stay Wonder-Filled
dresscode.description: Layer up! Think warm jackets, cozy scarves, and comfortable shoes. You'll be lying down, so bring extra blankets or a sleeping bag.

topics: What do you think about when you look at the stars?
If you could visit any planet, which would you choose?
Share your biggest dream or aspiration
Talk about moments that made you feel small in a good way
Discuss what infinity means to you
Share childhood memories about space or the night sky

steps.title: Find Your Spot
steps.subtitle: Location Scouting
steps.content: Research and drive to a location away from city lights. Parks, hills, or open fields work best. Check the weather forecast and moon phase—new moon nights offer the darkest skies.
ideas: Use light pollution maps online to find the darkest spots near you
Arrive before sunset to set up your cozy nest while you still have light

steps.title: Get Comfortable
steps.subtitle: Creating Your Sky Theater
steps.content: Lay out your blankets and arrange pillows. You want to be able to lie back comfortably for extended periods. Pour your hot drinks and settle in.
ideas: Create a little fort with blankets if it's chilly
Position yourselves so you're shoulder to shoulder or can hold hands easily

steps.title: Silent Observation
steps.subtitle: Just Be
steps.content: Start with 15-20 minutes of quiet stargazing. No talking, just looking. Let your eyes adjust to the darkness and notice how many more stars appear.
ideas: Try to find shooting stars—make wishes together

steps.title: Deep Conversations
steps.subtitle: Questions Under the Stars
steps.content: The vastness of the universe has a way of making us philosophical. Share your thoughts, dreams, fears, and wonders. There's something about the stars that makes vulnerability easier.
ideas: Take turns sharing what you're grateful for
Discuss where you see yourselves in 5, 10, 20 years
